results.title: The Tap dance kid. - Edited version
results.creator_credit: Barra Grant, Evelyn Barron and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Eight year old Willie Sheridan has a single passion - dancing. His twelve-year-old sister Emma wants to be a lawyer. When Willie, with Emma’s help, gets a chance to audition for summer stock, the entire family confronts the conflict between parents wishes and children’s dreams.
Edited version based on the book “Nobody’s family is going to change” by Louise Fitzhugh.

results.title: Big Henry and the polka dot kid
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Linda Gottlieb and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the novel ‘Luke Baldwin’s Vow’ by Morley Callaghan, about a ten year old orphan boy who goes to live with his aunt and uncle in rural Canada. Shows how the boy’s love for an old blind dog leads to conflict with his uncle who feels that the animal is impractical to keep.

results.title: Why we conserve energy: the witch of the Great Black Pool
results.creator_credit: Maureen Selwood and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Uses an animated allegory about the Land of the Scatterpods whose inhabitants love machines to emphasize the importance of energy conservation and utilization of solar, water and wind energy. Story by Marie Winn Miller. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Egypt: the struggle for stability
results.creator_credit: Antony Thomas and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Part of “The Arab Experience” series, this episode explains that Egypt is a study in contrast and conflict, a land of both water wheels and massive hydro-electric power facilities. It is a country with great potential in its natural resources and a level of poverty among the worst in the world.

results.title: Arab identity: who are the Arabs? (Episode 1)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Thomas and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Contrasts the diversity of one hundred and twenty-five million Arabs and the unifying power of their heritage. Shows the force of the Islamic faith as pilgrims throng to Mecca’s Great Mosque. Shows that four hundred miles to the North, Arab traditions are dying under political and Western influence.

results.title: The Other side of the coin = Il Rovescio della medaglia
results.brief_description: Documentary film about post World War II Italian migrants living in somewhat depressed circumstances in Sydney. A group of Italian men discuss their situations since arriving in Australia, the discrimination, their inability to obtain a decent paying job no matter how skilled they are, their inadequate living conditions and lack of money and education, and the threat of deportation if their political beliefs (particularly those of socialist/communist persuasion) are too radical in the minds of the incumbent Liberal government (1978) whose politics of assimilation appear to be the driving force. Loneliness and alienation are part of daily existence amongst the migrant community, more so with the older generation as their children having been taught English at school, refuse to speak Italian at home. There appears to be a sense of a loss of culture and language contrary to the perception that post-war Australia is made up of a multilingual and multicultural society. The background story to the film which provides the basis for discussion about migrant rights is the deportation in 1978 of a radical community worker, Ignazio Salemi. Includes archival footage of Italian labourers working the Queensland cane fields during the 1950s.

results.title: Painting time
results.creator_credit: David Vogt, John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Follows a young child totally absorbed in exploration of line, color and shape. Highlights gross motor skills and the concentration span of the four to five year old child. Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Little blocks
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Portrays an adolescent working with preschoolers. However the adolescent dominates all play activities until the child becomes disinterested. Shows the nonverbal clues given by the child which are ignored by the adolescent.

results.title: From my point of view
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Uses sequences showing children from the ages of two and a half to five and a half with an adult in order to analyse the ways in which a child’s egocentrism affects the ability to see another person’s point of view. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
